quote: You don't win with the best talent - you win with the five players who are able to play well together.
author: Thomas Carlyle
authorshortbio: Thomas Carlyle (4 December 1795 – 5 February 1881) was a Scottish philosopher, satirical writer, essayist, translator, historian, mathematician, and teacher.
authorbio: Thomas Carlyle (4 December 1795 – 5 February 1881) was a Scottish philosopher, satirical writer, essayist, translator, historian, mathematician, and teacher. Considered one of the most important social commentators of his time, he presented many lectures during his lifetime with certain acclaim in the Victorian era. One of those conferences resulted in his famous work On Heroes, Hero-Worship, and The Heroic in History where he explains that the key role in history lies in the actions of the 'Great Man', claiming that 'the history of the world is but the biography of great men'.

quote: Remember: upon the conduct of each depends the fate of all
author: Thomas Carlyle
authorshortbio: Thomas Carlyle (4 December 1795 – 5 February 1881) was a Scottish philosopher, satirical writer, essayist, translator, historian, mathematician, and teacher.

quote: All of us, at certain moments of our lives, need to take advice and to receive help from other people
author: Unknown
